v8:item.v8:content: Disable inactive users in Collaboration System
Enter your name, address, phone number…
User list context menu standard commands
User list context menu standard commands
Show subgroup users and inactive users
Show users that belong to subgroups
User will be blocked from logging in after a specified date or period of inactivity.
User is not allowed to log in, or is not granted login rights or startup rights (thin client, web client, thick client, automation, or external connection).

Settings.QueryText: SELECT Users.Ref AS Ref, Users.Prepared AS Prepared, Users.DeletionMark AS DeletionMark, Users.Invalid AS Invalid, Users.Description AS Description, Users.IsInternal AS IsInternal, Users.Comment AS Comment, -1 AS PictureNumber, CASE WHEN Users.IsInternal THEN FALSE WHEN Users.Invalid THEN FALSE WHEN Users.IBUserID = &CurrentIBUserID THEN TRUE WHEN &CanChangeOwnPasswordOnly THEN FALSE WHEN Users.IBUserID = &BlankUUID THEN FALSE ELSE TRUE END AS CanChangePassword, Users.IBUserID AS IBUserID, UsersInfo.* FROM Catalog.Users AS Users {LEFT JOIN InformationRegister.UsersInfo AS UsersInfo ON (UsersInfo.User = Users.Ref)} WHERE CASE WHEN &AllUsers THEN TRUE WHEN &SelectHierarchy THEN TRUE IN (SELECT TRUE FROM InformationRegister.UserGroupCompositions AS UserGroupCompositions WHERE UserGroupCompositions.User = Users.Ref AND UserGroupCompositions.UsersGroup = &UsersGroup) ELSE TRUE IN (SELECT TRUE FROM Catalog.UserGroups.Content AS UserGroupsComposition WHERE UserGroupsComposition.User = Users.Ref AND UserGroupsComposition.Ref = &UsersGroup) END

SELECT CatalogUserGroups.Ref, CatalogUserGroups.DeletionMark, CatalogUserGroups.Predefined, CatalogUserGroups.Parent, CatalogUserGroups.Description, CASE WHEN CatalogUserGroups.DeletionMark THEN 2 ELSE 3 END AS PictureNumber, CatalogUserGroups.Comment FROM Catalog.UserGroups AS CatalogUserGroups
